subject: Re: [junit] Runing only one Test class not the whole Suite
msgSnippet: See the attached test helper class.  In the main routine for your class, do public static void main(String[] args) { TestHelper.runTests(args,
messageBody:
See the attached test helper class. In the main routine for your
class, do

public static void main(String[] args) {
TestHelper.runTests(args, YourClass.class);
}

import junit.framework.*;

public class TestHelper {
public static void runTests(String[] args, Class testClass) {
try {
Test test;
if (args.length == 1 && args[0].startsWith("test")) {
test = (Test)testClass.getConstructor(new Class[]{
String.class
}).newInstance(new Object[] { args[0] });
}
else {
try {
test = (Test)testClass.getMethod("suite", null).
invoke(null, null);
}
catch(Exception exc) {
test = new TestSuite(testClass);
}
}
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(test);
System.exit(0);
}
catch(Exception exc) {
Log.warn(exc);
System.exit(1);
}
}
}
